contest-event.event-date:
Feb. 19, 2011 D Welsh Open Brass Band Entertainment Championship
Welsh Open Brass Band Entertainment Championship 0 Entertainments Contest
welsh-open-brass-band-entertainment-championship
Grand Pavilion, Porthcawl, Bridgend, Wales, UK Best Soloist: Jonathan Pippen (Trombone - BTM) Most Entertaining Band Presentation: Tylorstown Highest First Section Band not in main prizes: Staines Brass Youngest Player: Alexander Rees (Tongwynlais Temperance - 13) Graham Rees Memorial Award: Stephen Sykes (Trombone - Tredegar) Prizes - 1st £1000, 2nd £500, 3rd £300. 11 bands competed
Feb. 21, 2011, 1:13 p.m. July 3, 2020, 10:07 a.m.
1 Tredegar Town Band Ian Porthouse
2 BTM Band Tom Davoren
3 Tongwynlais Temperance Band Philip Harper
4 Staines Brass Melvin White
5 City of Cardiff (Melingriffith) Band Gareth Ritter
6 Bournemouth Concert Brass Dave Barringer
7 Burry Port Town Michael Thorne
8 Pontardulais Town Band Paul Jenkins
9 Lydbrook Band Ian Holmes
10 Tylorstown Band Gary Davies
11 Abergavenny Borough Band David Griffiths
Withdrawn Markham and District Band Adrian Morton
